thread.title: Police Build Kitty Condo for Stray Cat That Has Been Visiting Department For Years
thread.title_full: Police Build Kitty Condo for Stray Cat That Has Been Visiting Department For Years

author: Maya Chung
title: Police Build Kitty Condo for Stray Cat That Has Been Visiting Department For Years

organizations.name: been visiting department for years boston police
green puppy orange gator is spotted strolling around south carolina neighborhood

text:
Boston Police have made a kitty condo for a stray cat that’s been stopping by their department for three years. Officers in the Roxbury neighborhood of Boston have been feeding and caring for a calico cat they've dubbed “SWAT Cat” since 2013 but after the cat went missing for a few months, they decided to create a house for it, according to reports.
Read: Stray Cat Becomes Best Friends With Bear at Zoo: 'Wherever He Is, She's Not Far Off' 
They wanted to give her a place to “relax while visiting the police department.”
"Officer Jamie Pietroski, a 15-year veteran of the Boston Police Department, stayed late after work for several nights painstakingly preparing SWAT Cat's new home," the department’s website read.
Read: Rescue Team Frees Stray Cat Who Got His Head Stuck in a Fence 
The condo for the team mascot reportedly features a spacious studio interior layout, a large deck for outdoor dining and glass sliding doors offering panoramic city views, according to police.
SWAT Cat has since moved into her new home.
Watch: Opposites Attract: Big Black Bear and Feral Feline Are Unlikely Best Friends 
Related Articles: 3-Foot 7-Inch Bodybuilder Beats Competition Twice His Size Family Shocked When Dog Gives Birth to Green Puppy Orange Gator is Spotted Strolling Around South Carolina Neighborhood
